column2: The train departed promptly at eight fifteen.
Confirming the destination eased my mind.
London was written clearly in bold letters.
A cool breeze swept along the platform.
Seats were arranged in neat rows.
I found mine beside the window.
Fields passed in a green blur.
An umbrella rested in her bag.
One hundred and twenty miles per hour.
The ride felt smooth and even.
The conductor announced the next stop.
Reading would arrive in ten minutes.
I glanced at the route map.
The journey had only just begun.
A man typed on his laptop.
The password was printed above the seat.
A currency update caught my eye.
One pound equalled one point two six dollars.
A.I. and robotics filled the article.
This one was from the NHS.
The clinic was on Baker Street.
A gentle vibration signalled low battery.
A green icon lit the screen.
EXIT was written in bold red.
A theatre show caught my attention.
A sign displayed five minute wait.
We stepped back onto solid ground.
Stone and steel framed the street.
A nearby café caught my eye.
Prices were displayed in the window.
The scent of fresh bread filled the air.
Soft jazz played in the background.
The day was off to a perfect start.
